fullText: Mr. Rylance gives what may be the performance of the decade, a portrayal so thoroughly lived-in that you never catch him acting.
dtliExcerpt: Mr. Rylance gives what may be the performance of the decade, a portrayal so thoroughly lived-in that you never catch him acting.
bwwExcerpt: 'Jerusalem' could have been written in almost any year from the 1920s onward. Yet this work takes you places - distant, out-of-time places - that well-made plays seldom do. And it thinks big - transcendently big - in ways contemporary drama seldom dares...But Rylance also captures - to a degree I can imagine no other contemporary actor doing - Johnny's vast, vital, Falstaffian appetite for pleasure, for independence, for life itself.
showScoreExcerpt: Mr. Rylance gives what may be the performance of the decade, a portrayal so thoroughly lived-in that you never catch him acting.
